moves.2. Nf3 Nf6: Like the trickiness with the more than expected move, right at the opening.
moves.3. d4: And so the sacrificing thoughts begin...
moves.8. Qe3+: The Queen is doing her thing, protecting her man whilst harassing the Black King...
moves.9. Nc3 Nf5: The knight can also defend and attack...here the knight gives notice to the White Queen. Move or you lose!
moves.10. Qe4 O-O: Takes the pressure off, make white work for this.
moves.11. Bxe7: Very exciting game through-out. I see solid moves coming...
moves.12. Rd1 Nd6: The defense again defends and attacks in the single move....
moves.14. Be2: Things are good and even +/- both sides...
moves.14... Nc6: A redeveloping move that again attacks the Queen and exposing the new bishop pin!...
moves.15. Qf4 h6: A time waster here but it does make the knight rethink my side of the board...a better move....15....Bf5!
moves.17... Qe7+ 18. Kd2 Nxb5: defending c7 and gaining new real estate...
moves.19. Kc1: a crude form of the Queen-side castle.
moves.19... Be6: Finally the bishop emerges from his work...
moves.20. g4: White seems to formulate a swift king-side attack!
moves.20... Nc3: This had to blow the mind! Who'da thought of that?
moves.21. bxc3: That Queen side now has a rotten hole...
the only move I see as being the blunder...
moves.27. Rd2 g5: Why not? Let the lady know she is loved!...
moves.28. Qf6 Rd6: Defend the rook pawn and attack her holiness...
